mdRecord.dcterms:title: The Riverside Studio, exterior
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Goff, Bruce Alonzo (American architect, 1904-1982) [work]
Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: The building was designed for Mrs. Patti Adams Shriner, a music teacher who wanted to combine a music studio for teaching piano lessons with her living quarters. The rhythm of windows and inset tile forming diagonal patterns on the walls of the entrance hall drew their inspiration from musical scales. The round window on the front of the building derived its decorative pattern from musical scores that Goff composed while he was working on the design. Even the fountain designed by Alphonso Iannelli used abstract marble sculpture with pipes that dripped water over the sculpture onto chromium cups. These were of varying size to create music-like tones as the water splashed into the pool below. The Riverside Studio was listed in the listed in the National Register on June 14, 2001. -- http://www.tulsapreservationcommission.org/artdeco/buildings/index.pl?id=38 [work]
